page.description: Specifies if the chart image should be base64 encoded. (Not supported in all browsers).

section.description: Base64 encoding essentially takes binary data and converts it into ASCII. For more on Base64 you can reference [this Wikipedia page]. Here is an xbasic example using Base64 encoding and decoding. The 64base encoding allows you to turn a blob into a string and a string into a blob without losing any data.
section.example:
dim blob as b blob.resize(50) blob.pokew(1,23) blob.pokew(30,88) blob.pokec(3,"Hello World") ? blob.dump("A") = "..Hello World................X.................... "
? blob.peekw(1) = 23 ? blob.peekw(30) = 88 dim txt as c = base64encode(blob) ? txt = "FwBIZWxsbyBXb3JsZAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAABYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA="
dim blob2 as b = base64decode(txt) ? blob2.dump("A") = "..Hello World................X.................... " ? blob2.peekw(1) = 23 ? blob2.peekw(30) = 88
